intro: Weberbauerella brongniartioides, commonly known as the Peruvian lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant features strap-like leaves and produces clusters of blooms during the spring and summer seasons. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils with ample sunlight.
